private_information: I may only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
Disks A..O are labeled smallest to largest A smallest, O largest
agent_1.goal: Rearrange the towers so that left peg has top to bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O and middle peg has top to bottom A, B with right peg empty.

private_information: I may only move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
Disks A..O are labeled smallest to largest A smallest, O largest
agent_2.goal: Rearrange the towers so that left peg has top to bottom C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O and middle peg has top to bottom A, B with right peg empty.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate both agents outputs and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that encodes the cooperative two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and yields the ordered primitive move sequence that achieves the goal.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs and 15 disks labeled A..O where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 can move disks A through H only, agent_2 can move disks I through O only.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks A to O from top to bottom, middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top to bottom C D E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg has top to bottom A B, right peg empty.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move only disks A B C D E F G H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves consistent with the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Use the exact move line format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 for each primitive move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. You see the public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Produce the portion of the cooperative plan that involves only moves of disks you are allowed to move. Output a single ordered list of primitive moves where each line follows this format exactly: agent_1: move disk X from pegA to pegB. Do not produce PDDL. Ensure each move obeys the rules that only a top disk can be moved and no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller disk. Include only moves that move disks A through H. If you cannot determine some moves because they require moving disks you do not control, leave placeholders by omitting those moves and explain briefly at the end which moves you omitted in one short sentence.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can move only disks I J K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves consistent with the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Use the exact move line format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 for each primitive move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. You see the public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Produce the portion of the cooperative plan that involves only moves of disks you are allowed to move. Output a single ordered list of primitive moves where each line follows this format exactly: agent_2: move disk X from pegA to pegB. Do not produce PDDL. Ensure each move obeys the rules that only a top disk can be moved and no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller disk. Include only moves that move disks I through O. If you cannot determine some moves because they require moving disks you do not control, leave placeholders by omitting those moves and explain briefly at the end which moves you omitted in one short sentence.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate the agents move lists into a single coherent cooperative plan. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct and include agent identifiers in action names where appropriate.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here are the move lists from the agents. First agent_1 output: {moves_agent_1}. Second agent_2 output: {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these lists into a complete valid cooperative plan that respects all Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent movement restrictions. If the agents omitted necessary moves because of limited permissions, fill those gaps while respecting the constraint that only the designated agent may perform moves of a given disk. Produce the final artifacts required for FastDownwards: a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model two agents (agent_1 and agent_2) where actions are labeled by agent and disk moved, and the problem initial and goal states match the instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Additionally, append an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 that corresponds to the plan encoded by the PDDL.
